title: WHAT QUICK HITCH DO YOU NEED? CAT 1 VS CAT 2 QUICK HITCHES

tasks.task: Compare and choose between category one and category two quick hitches for tractor attachments.
subtasks: Determine the category of the tractor (e.g., 1025R, 4066R, 50, 45E).
Measure the inner-to-inner and outer-to-outer dimensions of quick hitches.
Understand the bushing requirements for category one and category two attachments.
Check the pin size compatibility for category one and category two quick hitches.
Consider the weight and shipping costs for category one and category two quick hitches.
Assess the dimensions of the top hook and lower links on both quick hitches.
Evaluate the pin sizing and compatibility between quick hitch types.
Consider additional components like top pins and floating top link adapters.
Determine the compatibility of attachments with the quick hitch (e.g., bushing requirements).

tasks.task: Prepare for installation by ensuring proper spacing and assembly.
subtasks: Verify the placement of attachments to avoid interference with the three-point hitch.
Secure all components (attachments, quick hitch, three-point arm) properly.
Test the connection to ensure stability and safety before operation.
Adjustments for stabilizer arms if necessary.
